website_summaries.verdict: A well-built faucet that feels solid and looks attractive. Works well and won't disappoint.
pros: Hose glides smoothly and moves easily between flow and spray
cons: Occasionally has an issue with plastic retainer for the hose, requiring a special attachment

customer_reviews.title: Its key inner parts that take force is made of ...
customer_reviews.text: Its inner parts is made of soft plastic, it can't last longer, it is broken in 1 and half year.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - Buy Another Faucet.....
customer_reviews.text: About 12 months after our purchase & install, the faucet was difficult to 'turn off' - It took a special handle tweak to stop it from dripping after every single use - Again, this is only 12 months after being newly installed! - Finally, I contacted Delta's customer service (good service) & they explained about their problematic cartridge - Sent me another cartridge to install - Problem OK for now......Likely will need another cartridge in the near future - Faucet Failure!
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Low Flow Water Restrictor makes this an awful faucet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this faucet previously and liked it so much I purchased another. I hate this one - it has a water flow regulator in it. I am all for those but not in the kitchen where you need some force behind your water to clean dishes, push items into the disposal, etc. the water flow is so low it is nearly useless. I believe I am using more water because of it trying to get the job done! I purchased the delta wrench separately and when it arrives hope to take this apart and remove the offensive piece that keeps it from functioning well. if you buy the faucet buy the little wrench!
customer_reviews.author: PAL8535

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I strongly encourage anyone thinking about a Delta touch to reconsider, the design of the solenoid is grossly flawed. The have the battery pack wire and the ground wire that senses when you touch it coming out of the same hole, when you call customer service when your faucet keeps turning on and off on there own, they will have you take multiple pictures to send them of your installation, then they will tell you you have to separate those two wires and insulate them from each other, because they cant touch, Ha, Ha, that's right they cant touch, but are still manufacturing them and selling them!!, once again DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: You will definetely get wet!!
customer_reviews.text: With the Delta name on it, I would have expected a better quality product. The only thing that is good is the ease of pushing it left to right; no problem maneuvering. However, I do not like that it doesnt have a “full” spray, it only sprays on either side simentaneously and has a space ibn the center. Why??? ☹️ Besides that, it sprays badly especially when you hit the button (need to keep your finger on it while using) on the faucet for the non spray feature!!!!! Wish I had spent the extra money and bought a better one in Home Depot. Lesson learned! Save your 💰
customer_reviews.author: linda.lu

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Works Extremely
customer_reviews.text: It took me much more time to take out the old one than put the new one in. The process, even in a tight space, was relatively easy and it functioned probably on the first try and has been doing so since it was installed several weeks ago. I would note that I had to create a small workaround to accommodate pipes obstructing the free working of the long spray hose. I was able to use a piece of cardboard to keep the hose away from the pipe. We are very pleased with this faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Ed George

customer_reviews.title: Best faucet I have had in years!
customer_reviews.text: I just cannot say enough good things about this faucet. It is very pretty, it was easy for my husband to install, the water pressure is so much better than our last one, and the three different spray options are worth every penny. When I put the spray head back in its housing, it clicks in place and stays there. It is so easy to change spray settings using one hand, and I am really glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet. My plumber was impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This faucet has a button that will create a bubble around an intense jet in the center which traps and deflects overspray back toward the center of the bubble. It's great for powering off food stuck on plates without spraying yourself and half the kitchen. The turnoff is a tiny bit more finiky than most faucets, but it is easy to get the hang of it and turn it off completely after you've used it a bit and I wouldn't let that stop me from buying this faucet. My plumber was really impressed with the bubble feature to contain the spray. It's not just a gimmick. It's a very useful feature.
customer_reviews.author: J. Latham

customer_reviews.title: Nice faucet, but....
customer_reviews.text: Nice faucet. It stop working after 2 months. Called Delta customer service and they replaced main switch for free. It took 2 weeks to arrive. The last one corroded from water I don't know how the water got in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kmarrow

customer_reviews.title: Great Faucet
customer_reviews.text: This faucet was purchased after reading the great reviews online and I couldn't agree more. It was easy to install and use. It complements the kitchen with its modern design. We especially like the Shield Spray technology with helps to reduce or prevent splashes when using the pull down nozzle. We also like the fact that it is not a finger print magnet and does not show water marks on its surface. Before installing it, be sure that you have at least 2-inches of space behind the faucet's position and the splash board/wall, to allow the control arm to function freely. No issues or complaints thus far.
customer_reviews.author: A. P. Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: There are two buttons now so it is too easy to press the wrong button
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that there is a new spray head being put on. I did not realize it until it was installed that it is a different spray. You lose half of the original spray - the one that stays on. The added new spray, the new "shield spray" is only on when you hold the button down. There are two buttons now so it is too easy to press the wrong button. I spent a lot of time reviewing faucets and kept coming back to this one because of the original spray feature. I called Delta and they offered to send out the old spray head for $168... really?!!! Wow.
customer_reviews.author: wheels

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've had this faucet since October, and it is one hell of an upgrade compared to what I've used up to now. The touch feature is actually really handy. Much easier to turn on and off VS. the handle, especially if my hands are dirty with raw meat or possible coronovirus. The negative thing about the touch feature is if the batteries run out, you won't have any water unless they are replaced. It's 6 AAs so just make sure you have them stocked up from Costco etc.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and functional
customer_reviews.text: Lovely kitchen fixture. The arctic stainless is very attractive with our black marble. Functions perfectly so far and it so much easier to maneuver with than our old one. The clearance above the sink is just perfect and allows us to easily fit larger things under it without bumping into the spout over and over. I love the simply handle and the easy switch from stream to spray. The magnetic closure is also really nice and the length of the hose allows us to completely clean our large, deep sink. If you're on the fence, this is a great product that feels well made and durable. The price is quite reasonable for such a nice fixture!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Design needs some work
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for a year now. It leaks when shutoff It will on rare occasions will dispense cold water It really likes hot water from water heater, and will provide warm or hot in all positions randomly. The sprayer head will relatch if you you pull it all the way out and bring it back. Would I recommend you purchase this pricey fixture....no What was Delta thinking?
customer_reviews.author: raven

customer_reviews.title: Needs Some Work
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Delta touch faucet (8 years old) that is more useful and controllable than this model. It always comes on hot the gets cooler as the water flows for awhile. The old model has a regular and higher pressure control and this model has a normal pressure control and a weird splasl option that sends water all over the sink and counter. The old model has a large, circular, high multi spray option. This model has two multi sprayers that are difficult to guide where you want them. Moral is that new and improved is not always both - in this case improvments make it worse. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Ghost in the machine
customer_reviews.text: The touch feature is sort of nice. We had a pro plumber install this and it seemed to be a job, replacing the old faucet. We have the battery pack, not the plug-in. We've noticed a couple of times the water comes on by itself. Fortunately it also shuts off automatically after a few minutes (I think the shut-off is an intentional feature). Emailed Delta tech support and no reply after 3 weeks so I called and got a helpful tech who had me reposition the battery pack. He said if it happens again they'll send a new solenoid. Apparently this is a know issue. Delta calls it "ghosting."
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at the handle after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved the looks of this faucet and the way it worked. However, after only a few months of moderate use , it started leaking at the handle. It evidently started at night because I found a huge mess in the kitchen one morning. I’m going to see if a plumber can fix it. If not, I’ll be looking for another brand. No more Deltas for me.
customer_reviews.author: Time to walk the dog, Dave

customer_reviews.title: Go with a different company
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 6 months until the light began to stay on all the time and drained batteries every 2 weeks. We contacted Delta customer service and received follow-up questions to answer. Since we responded to their questions we have not been able to continue the inquiry. We have called and emailed 3 times and each time they ask the same questions saying they will get in touch but nothing has happened. I would not recommend buying this product. Our plumber warned us that most of these have problems so we expected something to happen, but assumed the manufacturer would help with a warrenty claim, not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I admit...I officially am in love with my faucet. I did not think that was possible. This thing is incredible. It was a breeze to install and the touch technology is impressive. The water will turn on/off if you touch any part of the faucet (even the base), except for the pull down which I love. The spray shield also is great which I didnt think I would care about. We were concerned about the install based on reviews so had zip ties in hand. Never had to use them. For the price, and a great brand...this is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Big Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Faucet. Useless Touch Operating feature
customer_reviews.text: This faucet had the battery connected to it for 30 days, then I ripped it out. Turns on, on its own. Turns off and on when you accidentally bump it. I had no problems operating a standard valve bar on a faucet while cooking and dirty hands. This was a Engineered Feature dreamed up by Marketing as a solution Looking For A Problem!!!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Faucet drains battery and turns on by itself
customer_reviews.text: The AA batteries are supposed to last up to 2 years. My first batch lasted about 6 months, and the last batch lasted only 1 month. The faucet is completely useless without power, you cannot even turn it on manually. Worse after about 6 months of use, the faucet started turning itself on randomly. I purchased the AC adapter, part EP73954, to solve the battery drain issue. But the problem with the faucet turning on by itself remains. I should have read the other reviews that have revealed similar issues before making this bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hahn T.

customer_reviews.title: Best ever when you're up to your elbows in bread dough.
customer_reviews.text: Correcting a comment I made last week about having problems...I was getting ready to call the plumber today- no water no how - no touch no manual. Even though the light came on, sometimes, I wanted to check the batteries...the batteries were fine...the problem was that a while back, my under sink reverse osmosis system was serviced, and my Delta faucet battery pack got bumped, and the battery pack top was loosened. Snapped it into place. WATER WATER WATER!!!! Moral of story- check your battery case and batteries BEFORE you call the plumber. Just like you always check your breakers before you call your A/C tech. Good day to all!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install Delta Leland
customer_reviews.text: This pull-down kitchen faucet looks great and was pretty easy to install. I did have to trim the water lines but I'd rather have them too long than too short. The different sprayer functions work great. No complaints after 1 month. EDIT. It's been over 3 months now and I am disappointed in this faucet. Tring to adjust the water temperature is difficult, to say the least. It is a fine line between extremely hot, to very cold water temperatures. I have yet to get used to it. There is a hot water control function but this renders the water temperature to barely lukewarm. I would not recommend not would I purchase this faucet again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike21228

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control worst faucet on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This product I thought was going to be at aid to my disabled wife rumor toward arthritis and a paraplegic touch on and off works kind of nice but the temperature control is the worst I have ever used cannot control the hot or cold water with the joystick type on an off lever that switches it From cold to warm water or hot impossible to get that in between just right temperature very poorly designed looking for refund or replacement of this unit from the company that makes it. I would not buy it again until the address those issues buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like this faucet overall but I do have one complaint. The sprayer does not sit flush when retracted. I've uploaded a picture to show what I mean. It's not the end of the world but wish I would have noticed it before I installed it. As other reviewers suggested, I also used zip ties to hold the clip more securely. While it didn't come off for me, it just did not seem very secure.
customer_reviews.author: JMG

customer_reviews.title: Ghost and no water
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item appx. one year now. I believe the unit is made of solid quality. However, it has a way to turn on when it wants too and many times it won't even run. I have changed the location of the battery unit and batteries as I have also had contact with Delta and those were things I was instructed to do along with sending pictures etc..etc.. I am not a plumber and this thing was expensive to get installed. My wife hates it as it still remains to do it's own ting. I am purchasing something else today!
customer_reviews.author: CSM

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK.  I was ROBBED
customer_reviews.text: The description is a total lie. You cannot touch anywhere to turn on. There is no light indicator. It’s a plastic piece of crap. I hired a plumber and spent close to $600.00 to install bathroom faucets and this piece of garbage. I want my money back and reimbursement for my plumber. Don’t lie to good customers who spend a fortune with you. I hope you do as I ask and send me a Faucet that does the things I paid for. Ask Jeff to send with an apology note especially at one of the worst times in HISTORY...,.. a very unhappy customer
customer_reviews.author: Karen lamb

customer_reviews.title: Delta kitchen Faucet!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Delta Faucet Leland Single-Handle faucet for my new kitchen sink. I loved that it was a pull down sprayer. It has the ShieldSpray option that I really like. This is my first Touch20 faucet and I will never go back to a regular faucet. When I am cooking and have my hands with raw chicken and other foods on them I just use the top of my hands or arm to turn the faucet on and off without having to use my hands. I had the kitchen faucet installed by a professional with my powder room faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Not Stable for Long-Term - Needs Tightening Frequently
customer_reviews.text: Faucet doesn’t stay in place on ceramic sink. Has to be tightened down frequently and can be complex based on location. Asked my plumber to tighten (better tools) and they recommended replacement. Plumbers are aware of the problem with this model. Disappointed in Delta quality - relied on what I thought was a reputable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeside77

customer_reviews.title: Loos nice, but is hard to shut off fully
customer_reviews.text: Installed ok but my wife and I both have to check it to make sure it doesn't drip or run when we try to turn it off. It seems to make a faint grating/squeaking noise when we shut it off and then drips. If we carefully adjust it, the faucet stops running. I expected it to work better since it was from Delta and not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: B. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: This Faucet has a Turn Off Issue
customer_reviews.text: I’m a bit disappointed with this kitchen faucet. The problem I’m having with it is, when turning off the water flow, you have to keep on eye on it to make sure the water actually stopped running. Otherwise, it continues leaking with a steady trickle. You have to make a concentrated effort on moving the lever to the left with a firm motion. If you have kids using this faucet, they’re not going to be conscious of this defect, and your faucet is going to keep running. I would return this faucet; but it’s part of my kitchen remodel, which included new countertops, and I don’t want the added hassle at this time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Never thought I would like a faucet this much!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Bought it for the spray shield feature (and that is pretty cool) but the on off by touch is a game-changer! Took a few washing sessions to get used to it but now I'm bumping all my fiends sinks thinking they will turn on for me :) It's so quick and sensitive you barely have to touch any part of it for on/off. BUT, they were smart enough to make the nozzle a non-touch point. Has a cool light that turns from blue/purple/red as the water gets hot, and auto turns off if you leave running too long (not too quick, only if you forget it). Been telling everyone this is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: weak1522

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!!- malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: We just remodeled our kitchen and installed this faucet. I am in love with it. Its beautiful and i love the touch on and off. *UPDATE* After having this faucet for a couple months now i have noticed that it turns on and off by itself and doesn't work sometimes. I have tried all the recommendations to fix the problem but it still happens. I LOVE the faucet when it works properly but do not know that i would recommend this product to anyone due to the price and not functioning properly.
customer_reviews.author: krysta

customer_reviews.title: This was a horrible purchase. Controlling the hot/cold water mix is close ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a horrible purchase. Controlling the hot/cold water mix is close to impossible. Moving the handle an 1/8" can cause the water to go from cold to scalding. Same in the other direction. When selecting the spray feature, the button locks in position. Bad design. My previous faucet released to stream when the water turned off. Much more convenient. I DO NOT recommend this faucet.
customer_reviews.author: 78zinman

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement and upgrade
customer_reviews.text: House built 2006, Moen faucet (SS) base rusted out, spray head died. Discontinued replacement parts Plastic not (SS). BYE Moen. Was looking at Kohler, this was cheaper better materials ( ie SS all metal construction) and had great warranty reviews and not discontinued......and the price was VERY reasonable even compared to Kohler. Install was pretty straight forward and simple and video was a big help. Took longer to get out old rusted Moen. Works great hope to get years of use from it.
customer_reviews.author: Stormleadr

customer_reviews.title: Delta replaced defective part pronto!
customer_reviews.text: I had my kitchen remodeled and this was installed October 2019 by a plumber and I thought it turned off strangely. When you shut it off it must be exactly in one very tiny spot. Every single handle faucet I have ever owned shut off with pushing it in one direction no preciseness need. My family and I think it's off and it's still running or dripping, and I'm guessing this faucet is now gonna cost me more because it sounds like a defective valve assembly. UPDATE After contacting Delta they replaced the defective part and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic nozzle is not working
customer_reviews.text: I read what seemed like hundreds of reviews before purchasing this faucet. Have to say, I’m a little disappointed. I feel like it looks scratched on certain parts of the faucet. Also, the magnet nozzle is not working. At the store the magnetic was very tight.. this one not so much. In fact I have to push the nozzle within a inch before it picks up the magnetic function. I just installed this today, so I plan on contacting delta to see what they can do for me. I had to pay to install it, so to have to go and uninstall it to get another one is an expense and honestly a hassle. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot research on this and other faucets. I bought because I liked the no splash setting. I was very disappointed in that setting. It still splashes and the faucets doesn’t have a lot power behind it. When retracting you have to manually feed the tubing back in. I expected more from this faucet and was disappointed. It looks great but the functionality is not that good.
customer_reviews.author: lisa arndt

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a year before a few things broke.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great faucet: nice modern look, useful/handy touch sensor, and good spout. The biggest downside of it -- as is -- is that the temperature is hard to manage (i.e. the one handle changes temperature too fast) After about a year, we also had two issues: * the cold water light (blue) stopped working (even after replacing battery) * the magnetic ring that holds the spout up rusted and broke, and now the spout does not stay in place. I am wondering how to fix these problems?
customer_reviews.author: BuguZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product with cool features
customer_reviews.text: We are always cooking/baking and switching to this faucet made a world of difference. We had an older Moenn and started to leak. This delta looks way nicer and functions way better. We use all 3 modes and love the fact you can tap it to turn off and on. It is pricey, but worth it for the features.
customer_reviews.author: Jakestaggs

customer_reviews.title: Great look, poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Nice look, beautiful chrome. Faucet stinks. Adjustment is too sensitive ,scalding to stone cold in 1/3 inch movement, , If you adjust the temp, the water flow also changes (annoying). Select spray or aerator and water splashes all over. Tiny filter parts in the spray head are not available at retailer and fill up every couple of months. (I finally took them out just to keep the water going). It's a great price point for what this faucet could have been . I suspect the bean counters screwed-up a good product in pre-production.
customer_reviews.author: CLASSIC hvac-maniac

customer_reviews.title: Delta is a Top Name Faucets.
customer_reviews.text: We have not used this one yet. We are using one that is identical to the one we bought. The plumber cleaned up the one we have been using and it seems to be working fine. We have had it for approximately 9 years. We are keeping the one we just bought in reserve in case we need it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Reints

customer_reviews.title: Delta's Customer Service was GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I wanted to give this 5 stars but had to reduce it to 4 stars because the faucet developed a drip (wouldn't fully shut off) after 3 years. But, I was very pleased with customer service whom I called for a replacement. The customer service rep was pleasant and offered to send me a replacement cartridge at no charge. (Well, actually this is within Delta's warranty.) Two days later I received the cartridge. Installation was a snap! Problem solved. I must confess that good customer service always reduces or eliminates occasional product issues. I plan on using Delta in the future. P.S. I have had good reliability with Delta faucets in the past.
customer_reviews.author: LCH

customer_reviews.title: Very nice faucet.
customer_reviews.text: I am not rating the ease of installation as I had my plumber do it. However, it seemed to go in easily enough. This faucet is very simple to use, and although my wife an I had never used a "touch" faucet before, after about an hour of working in the kitchen with it, it became very straightforward—just tap with any part of your hand or arm anywhere on the faucet and the water is on or off. The finish is great, the shape is exactly what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M Morris

customer_reviews.title: The pull-out faucet is so far superior to the previous one I can't even begin to ...
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it attractive and functional, installation was a BREEZE! It's not Delta's fault that my connections were a little difficult to reach, but the instructions were clear while appropriately detailed. The neck is high enough that in my 9"-deep sink there is PLENTY of pressure to assist in removing most residue on cooking pans, which reduces the number of times I have to soak things before finishing my cleaning. The pull-out faucet is so far superior to the previous one I can't even begin to describe--the hose is flexible and does not kink, and the weight moves easily along the hose so that replacing the head is a non-event. I will possibly purchase another for my son's home!
customer_reviews.author: Momofthree

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the money, don't get the Touch version!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap square plastic buttons make an otherwise nice faucet look cheap. The slightest touch anywhere will turn your water off while you're trying to use it, and it sometimes takes 3 or 4 taps to get it to turn back on (the light comes on but no water). Also, if you turn the water off at the handle without tapping, the light stays on which I assume will drain the batteries in no time. If it wasn't such a pain to install I'd return it, absolutely not the quality I expect from Delta. I regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McG

customer_reviews.title: beautiful, high quality, well designed
customer_reviews.text: This faucet was very easy for me, a 70 year old lady, to install. The hoses were already attached. The enclosed directions were clear and easy to follow. Beautiful design, quality craftsmanship. Spray nozzle docks securely but is easy to detach when needed. Buttons on the nozzle head conveniently change water from stream to spray or a combination of a very narrow powerful stream enclosed in a wider flow. I love this faucet. I also love that I was able to buy it at a significant discount because it was new, in original packaging, but had been returned to Amazon through Kohl's.
customer_reviews.author: Susannah Blue

customer_reviews.title: This fun in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I looked at several different faucets for a kitchen remodel and settled on this one. It works and looks great. I really like the touch on, touch off feature. I looked at the ones that used proximity sensing but felt there would be too many accidental turn ons or turn offs. This works great. You give it a short touch and it turns on or off. If you hold it longer say for moving the faucet from one sink to the other, it won't change state. I can't say anything about the battery life as we have only had it for a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P. Blaschka Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design
customer_reviews.text: In all my years, this has to be the worst-designed faucet ever! It always has to be doubled checked to make sure it is turned off; you can leave the room and come back hearing a trickle or water running slowly - there is no area where you can FEEL that the faucet is lined up at turning it off, The SPECIAL FEATURE is so not needed and more of a hassle with water spraying everywhere. The sprayer selection only sprays on both sides of the nozzle - not across the middle. Just not my "cup of tea". Would not recommend this at all! Sorry! :\
customer_reviews.author: RescueFurryKids

customer_reviews.title: buy a normal faucet
customer_reviews.text: Faucet is a gimmick. Would buy the regular faucet if I could do it over again. Seems to turn on and off randomly when using it, sometimes it won't turn on at all. Faucet looks nice, just wish I would have gone with the old fashioned one instead of the David Copperfield version. Update - We've had this faucet a couple months now and it has already stopped working and fresh batteries won't fix the problem. I would give it a zero if I could. It is a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: Remove the screen for good water pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this faucet. Did way too much “research” looking at different models from different brands and happy I landed here. I didn’t notice a water pressure issue almost from the start. It seemed to get worse with time. Tonight I took off the faucet head and disassembled the aerator. Inside the head where it attaches to the hose is a screen they recommend cleaning occasionally. While trying to clean it, it popped out. I reattached the head without the screen and now absolutely love the water pressure. I recommend doing the same. Pictures show the removed screen.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Looks and functions great!!
customer_reviews.text: I did not personally install this as it was part of a kitchen remodel and the plumber installed the faucet. This is one great looking faucet. I thought the faucet it replaced was pretty nice, but this one is way better. I really like the magnetics that keep the pull down faucet in place. This is a real thick looking faucet. We wanted a chrome rather than the brushed look so that was another reason we got this make and model. So far the operational functions work just fine. If you want an attractive functional faucet we think you will like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Redmond jack

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality leaked after less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: I have the Delta Leand Single Handle Pull-Down Kitchen Faucet with magnetic docking model. It was professionally installed in March of 2017. It is nice looking but it has already started leaking after only three months of use. Our older faucet lasted for over 15 years and this has lasted months. The handle does not shut off the water completely and leaves a continuous drip. I am very disappointed that such an expensive model is so cheaply made. I honestly can not recommend this product to anyone. One unhappy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Minh Vu

customer_reviews.title: very good quality for a somewhat more reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this faucet for about 3 months. The features we like: the magnetic removable head - it gives a very definite click when the head is docked ; the hose is very flexible so it makes the head easy to remove and move around to wash out the sink; because the nozzle rotates 360 degrees you can position the control lever anywhere you want - we angled it a little out from the usual 90 degree to the side position for easier access. What we haven't found all that great is the highly touted "shield spray" feature. No problem though - we just don't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brand

customer_reviews.title: Delta touch kitchen fat
customer_reviews.text: Have had one at house for 5 years. Love it. Had to get two more for other houses as so used to touching it yo turn on we were always trying to figure out why the non touch ones did not come on when touched. Really like. It. Magnet holder that holds the wand in place should’ve stainless, but is not. Inexpensive and easy to replace. Like the electric controller but batteries last a long time too
customer_reviews.author: Construction Safety Professionals, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: After 9 months I'm done
customer_reviews.text: Installed about 9 months ago and was OK with it at first. I've had to replace the (6 AA) batteries about every 3 months (Instructions claim 2-year expected life) and every now and then it will decide to just not work. In a lovely feat of enginerring the faucet does not work at all unless you have batteries in it. So if you'd like to have just a basic, dependable, working 100% of the time facuet, you are out of luck. Batteries used: Energizer MAX, Energizer Lithium, and now Duracell (never mixed) If you want to charge 3 or 4 times as much as other faucets, please give us a quality-based, cost-benefit justification in doing so.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stout

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet
customer_reviews.text: Installed it 5 months ago, and it's great. Best feature is the "powerful stream of water inside a protective sphere that contains the splatter." I'd describe it as a single, tiny but strong jet stream surrounded by a 4" globe stream. It's perfect for rinsing the sink and directing food particles to the drain. You're not just chasing them around the drain with the two other spray choices. This feature is selected by a spring-loaded, push-to-use button next to the typical rocker switch. Another benefit of this spring button is to cancel the multi-jet spray and return to normal aerated flow. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: HiFast

customer_reviews.title: The description is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This product has the same item number and description as the ones sold at plumbing distributors, however it's not the same as this is one you can expect to buy at Home Depot or Lowes....most of the parts are plastic and the line to the spray head is not braided steel as described using the item number. I thought I was saving about $60 , but instead I feel like I will have to replace this sooner than expected. Oh yeah..the finger print technology is a joke....every time you touch it you will leave finger prints
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.....
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst faucet I've ever owned. It's difficult to control the temperature, it's either super hot or cold, it's either full force or off...I'm pretty much hating it! I gave the faucet that this one replaced to a a friend, nothing was wrong with it, I wanted the splashless feature, which doesn't exist.;.... I had a plumber install it so that added to the waste of money. I thought Delta was a good brand, I guess not anymore.....save your money and keep shopping....
customer_reviews.author: Sabastiana

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I have put about 10 kitchen faucets in over the last 50 years and this, by far, is the worst faucet that I have used. To turn the water off you have to find the "sweet" spot or it will drip. When one uses the spray then you have to remember to turn the spray off or it will begin in spray mode the next time it is used. This product has only been in place for 100 days or so but my wife begged me to get rid of it so I replaced it with a Moen. The Moen faucet is fantastic and I am the new kitchen sink hero!!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip D. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Worst sink my family has ever used. Stay far away.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst sink I’ve ever had the pleasure of using, I don’t even know where to begin. The touch controls work MAYBE half the time, the sink constantly comes loose, forcing us to re-tighten every week, and sometimes if you walk past it, it just magically turns on by itself without the user doing anything. The only good thing about this sink is it looks nice. TL;DR: Don’t complicate your sink with touch and “smart” technology. All the “features” in this make it a worse sink at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: great faucet, one quibble
customer_reviews.text: Awesome faucet in every way but one. Sturdy, pretty, cool features (the two different sprays, the pull out hose) which all work flawlessly. The one CON is that the "off" position seems not to be intuitive. So far everyone who uses my kitchen sink leaves the faucet dripping, and I have to go shift the lever slightly forward of center to turn it completely off. Even I myself am still leaving it dripping, after 4 weeks of use. Somehow it is difficult to get used to the off position being a little bit "off" of where expected.
customer_reviews.author: doghairstew

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The jet bubble feature is a neat idea but the bubble keeping spatters contained is someone’s wet dream. That said the little jet works well at getting into hard to access cracks and crevices. The only fault I have is that you have to put some time and attention into finding the off position every time it’s used, some times you look back to a drip sometimes a full trickle. It’s not the end of the world but would be better ( 4 stars ) if it had a little more dead zone for the off position.
customer_reviews.author: david macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Touch feature stopped working after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy and excited about this faucet but the Touch feature stopped working after 3 weeks! We tried all the manufacturer's trouble shooting recommendations but nothing works. The faucet even turns on by itself when we are not there! Don't buy it. Totally not reliable and consistent. The worst thing is, once you've installed it, taking it off to return it is not an easy task... The technology just isn't there yet. Don't waste your money. Delta faucet should spend more time developing a more reliable product before pushing it out on the market and tarnishing its name. A big disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: A C

customer_reviews.title: MASSIVE faucet
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's just me or what but my gosh, this faucet is HUGE!! I mean it's massive compared to other faucets I've seen. The faucet in the showroom at the place where I'm getting my granite counters is lovely and a great size. I watched the videos, looked at pics, read reviews and ordered. Sending it back and will shop in the store so I can see for myself the actual sizes of these pull down faucets. It may be the Cadillac of all faucets but you can have it back!
customer_reviews.author: kms

customer_reviews.title: Not close to Delta’s best engineering or product quality
customer_reviews.text: Annoying design flaw whereby finding the exact “off” position to stop dripping requires fiddling with the exact handle position every time. Looks nice but Its a pretty lightweight faucet and tends to feel quite cheaply made, especially when using the sprayer pullout. The entire faucet flexes too easily in the weak base when pulling out/using the sprayer. Delta customer support is excellent though. Next time I will consider buying a higher end Delta product.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking badly after just 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: No problem for the first year and then the leak started slowly. Now 2 years later when I try to stop the water flow completely, it takes 3-4 tries before successfully stopping the flow. I need to find out if their lifetime warranty means something.
customer_reviews.author: rarewire

customer_reviews.title: Owned less than 3 weeks before by the time we had issues
customer_reviews.text: Though the faucet fits into our space, it looks very large. It would probably look better in a grander, new kitchen. Overall, I was fine with it though because I was happy with the function. However, now less than 3 weeks after purchasing we are having issues. The faucet started running on its own and I wasn't able to turn it off with the censor, I had to use the handle. Not long after, I wasn't able to turn the faucet on with the censor or the handle - i.e. no water coming out of the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Hootie

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent faucet! I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 due to the horrible instructions. I've installed faucets before and it only took me about an hour to remove the old faucet and install this one. However, I basically tossed the instructions in the trash as they are worthless. At least the supply lines are color coded (red for hot, and blue for cold). The faucet itself is fantastic. Operation is smooth and the flow is great. Nozzle stays in place when not in use and the handle operates nice and smooth. It looks great on our sink. The neck also sounds 360°, allowing you to install with the handle facing in any direction. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Installation was easy. You need a second person to help hold ...
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews before purchasing this faucet. Finally decided this was the right one. Product came in and I installed the faucet following a video on you tube. Installation was easy. You need a second person to help hold the faucet in place while you tighten from under the sink. Seems to be a well made product. We had issues with our other faucet (American standard) where the faucet wouldn’t retract back all the way. This faucet seems to have a better design on that mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: Shame on Delta
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice faucet. Heavy, solid and works smooth. But after we installed it the base seemed a bit wobbly. After some research we found we needed a stabilizer to stop the wobbling because our stainless steel sink was thin. Needless to say we think this should have been included in the box or some sort of heads up should have been given. I've now found that Delta supposedly will send you the part for free, but what good will that do after you already had it installed? Shame on Delta.
customer_reviews.author: CL4P-TP

customer_reviews.title: Editor's choice? No way
customer_reviews.text: We had the faucet professionally installed 1.5 years ago. It stopped working today. First the lights did not come up (after two months) and now it won't start. The last thing it did started up itself without anyone touching. Yes we replaced the batteries several times throughout its lifetime. It seems that the box controlling the water flow is wet for some reason. I am looking for some other touchless faucets now. Complete waste of money. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about purchasing this due to the splashless technology. However, I really don't use it like I though I would. The worst part about this faucet is that it is rather unforgiving when you are attempting to get the right temperature of water. Just a tiny adjustment on the handle makes the water either too hot or too cold. I rarely write negative reviews, but this faucet isn't as functional as I would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Tamra Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and functional design
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in less than an hour, including removal of the old faucet. I did not need to use the 3 hole cover so can't say how that would have impacted the install. No leaks first time around so design and connections were quality. I like the fact the swivel connection on the hub is at least 4 inches above the countertop so it shouldn't get corroded and bind like the last faucet. Really good water flow. Pleased so far. If it drops water pressure or develops leaks over time I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Lafolette

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: My parents have a touch2O faucet and loved it so much they got one when they moved as well. So when remodeling our kitchen, I wanted one! The style is gorgeous. It was easy for the plumber to install, he just had to look up on YouTube since there were no instructions included and it was his first time seeing one. It is nice to set the temp and force of the water and simple tap the faucet real quick when you need it! This goes great with my deep SS sink! My cat has NOT figured this out yet either!
customer_reviews.author: stmi

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful faucet. The touch works nearly perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical how well the touch feature would be in actual operation but it works beautifully. That it can discern between a touch (on/off) and a grab (move the arm or change the flow and/or temperature) is stellar. The temperature indicator is very useful and the pull out head actually retracts easily unlike several previous faucets we've had. And the whole fixture just looks beautiful. Super pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Larry in DE

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had this professionally installed and was very glad I did as the configuration of my sink meant that a part had to be modified. The installation took some time, but the faucet works great and looks beautiful. So far I love everything about. It works well. The sprayer is easy to use and it was easy to get used to turning it on and off and how to touch it to move the faucet, etc. Overall it makes my kitchen work easier and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Grandma

customer_reviews.title: My husband and kids hate this faucet.
customer_reviews.text: We have never had one like this before. First the hot is on the right and the cold is on the left. My family finds this hard to adapt to and it is very frustrating. Second the spray options suck. There are two lines/rows on the sides. It makes it difficult to spray anything as the water is on the sides. The other spray option is pretty useless. Doesn't really work at all. But hey it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Medora Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works great
customer_reviews.text: Much better flow and temperature control than the Kohler it replaced, which only lasted about two years BTW. This Delta looks better than we expected. We always had "ambidextrous" center-handled models so I wasn't sure about this one. It hasn't been a problem at all. It was easy (as easy as working under the sink can be) to install and works great. The spray shield feature is nice although we don't use it that often. The temperature is easy to regulate. Our Kohler would never get hot enough; this one seems very balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Seanjon

customer_reviews.title: Love my new faucet
customer_reviews.text: My last Delta kitchen faucet died! Honestly, it was never one that I liked all that much. Since my old one some new features have been added to the newer faucets. I love the shield spray. We were also happy to see you can now plug into an electrical outlet for the Touch 2.0 feature, saving on batteries. We already had an outlet under our sink so it is truly a win-win situation.
customer_reviews.author: katpow

customer_reviews.title: Temperature adjustment terrible.  Would not recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, and it feels good to operate. The magnets do a good job of holding the head in the spout. But there's one glaring problem - while the range of temperature adjustment seems large, there really only a fractional spot to get the handle in if you want warm water, and it exists somewhere in about a half-degree of the 45 degree arc of the handle. You can get hot water, or you can get cold water. But if you want warm water, be ready to spend a few minutes nudging the handle back and forth until you can find that tiny sweet spot that returns a temperature that neither burns nor freezes.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Bell

customer_reviews.title: Soiled item.
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box and immediately noticed dirty fingerprints / grease marks all over the faucet. Also it did not have a plastic sleeve over the unit. I suspect this is a returned item which should have been revealed in the item description. Will update when the plumber installs it on Thursday. If everything ok I will add a star and not request a refund/return. Disappointing that seller didn't mention that in description.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, nice updated look
customer_reviews.text: Installed a new stainless sink, so had to get a new faucet. Did not want to get a faucet I talked to so this seemed reasonably priced. It looks very nice with the new square corner sink. Spray controls work as described. Docking spray head is very secure with a strong magnet. Single lever control allows small incremental changes in water flow and temperature and stays put. I had to get used to the Full-off position, as it is not forward, but more a full-left position. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rainman

customer_reviews.title: Overall I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this fawcet about a month now and I love it. There may be 2 potential problems later on. The magnet that holds the sprayer isn’t too strong so sometimes it doesn’t catch and the weight at the bottom can catch on things under the sink slowing it down. Also, the handle is kind of different, if you are in a hurry and don’t make sure it’s pushed up all the way, the water will stay in. Otherwise I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Amantite

customer_reviews.title: Didn't realize HOW bad the original one was until this DELTA was installed!
customer_reviews.text: OMG...what a difference from the "low-rise" handle that was replaced. Love this - high height allows much easier cleaning of larger pots and pans. Spray is perfect and now even the plants can get refreshed in the sink! (They're lovin' it!) Magnetic spray head is terrific, and hose extension works great. Even the control handle is so much better than the relic previously used. It's amazing how little it takes to make one happy (sometimes!) - and this is one of those times.
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Amazon!

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Lovely with my new Krause sink. I ordered a matching soap dispenser separately. Some things to get used to: •faucet can be rotated too far over the counters (see photo) •sprayer is so forceful my counters get wet if I’m not careful •the spray is not a full circle; it’s two parenthesis (see photo) •the unique square button is to use when cleaning dirty plates. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this DELTA faucet!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it 0 stars! Installed this DELTA faucet 6 months ago. The faucet leaks from the spout when water is not on, and it also leaks from the bottom by the base. The leak from the base is damaging my butcher block counter top. The faucet was $208.00!! Very upset!! Will not buy Delta again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Seewald

customer_reviews.title: Some things need to be changed but still pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to be able to turn the faucet on/off by touching the spout but the infrared sensor that detects objects in the wash area has to go. It has turned off while washing items when I dont want it to turn off in about 25% of my wash sessions. The led indicator that shows water temperature is awesome! When i installed it the directions were pretty straightforward but the nut that secures the unit to the counter was too tight. Not enough room to wiggle it on there. I was swearing a lot while getting it on there. The spacing between the tubes was the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Works great after priming the nozzle hose.
customer_reviews.text: All worked out fine after clearing out guck out of nozzle hose. Main water feed upper end through neck of faucet clogged up with gunk/debris. Need blow out so water can get through to operate. Other than that issue, it seems like a great faucet. Very good pressure. Maybe more than replaced unit. Stream can be toned down if desired but left alone for great stream.
customer_reviews.author: tomsxx

customer_reviews.title: faucet looks great and was easy for my son to install
customer_reviews.text: My previous faucet for the kitchen did not even make it 9 yrs so I had to purchase this update. I liked the look and the reviews. It has been installed for over a week and works well. It took my son who is and auto mechanic, not a plumber less than an hour to install. So at this time I would recommend this product, check back in about 9 years to see if still works.
customer_reviews.author:
Laura
Laura
Lauraz1964

L auraz1964.

customer_reviews.title: i almost installed it myself
customer_reviews.text: needed a plumber's help for a cutoff valve, but otherwise, I could have installed this myself. All the hardware is included. Pull down sprayer reconnects solidly with the powerful magnet. The splash control spray takes a little getting used to. I think it works best on dinner plates and not so well on smaller items. The "throw" in the lever from hot to cold is small, so if your hot water is very hot, finding a balance might be a little tricky.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: One of the worse product I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: If you want to add more complication to your life this is the faucet for you. This is designed incredibly poorly. It comes on and off erratically. Sensitive to water droplets around the base. When you touch the directional water head it turns off AND now, the final straw...less than one year since I purchased it, it's not working. Oh, did I mention that you have to replace batteries constantly for it to operate and there's NO WAY to override the touch mechanism? Please don't waste your money. I've tried to live with this faucet for 11 months and I'm replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, but the single lever leaves no margin ...
customer_reviews.text: Good overall, but the single lever leaves no margin for error when turning it off. There's one position and one position only that cuts off the dripping. It's the only faucet I've ever purchased that felt like it was about to leak out of the box. So far, so good, but it's a fussy little thing.
customer_reviews.author: AndAnotherThing

customer_reviews.title: Water temp. and force difficult to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old single handle kitchen faucet with this one. My old one wasn't a pull down faucet. I really like the styling of this one and the pull down feature with magnetic docking. However, it is VERY difficult to get the right water temp. along with the right water force I want. The water's either too hot, cold or the water force is too weak or too strong. As I said, my old faucet was also a single handle, so I know how to work one, but I just can't seem to find that "sweet spot" on this one to get warm water along with the right water force.
customer_reviews.author: Caneman

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - This is NOT a Touch2O faucet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just had this installed today. It is advertised as a Touch2O, I ordered spot shield stainless and Touch2O. Though there were batteries in the box, there is nothing Touch2O about this faucet. It is simply a standard faucet with the shield spray option. The shieldspray is a bit weird but I need to spend some time using it. Just running it there is still mist all over the outside of the sink (but you are only supposed to run it off dock). You must hold the button for the duration of using this spray, it doesn't stay on otherwise. I have already paid someone to install so I'm stuck with the standard version.
customer_reviews.author: WLL

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well
customer_reviews.text: This faucet has been a pain from the very beginning. After installation, the faucet would turn on when we merely walked by the sink, so my husband had to put in a grounding wire to stop that from happening. Now it is sporadic, sometimes it turns on with a lift of the handle, sometimes it takes several tries. Sometimes the "touch" feature works, sometimes it doesn't. Totally frustrating faucet, I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond H Osburn

customer_reviews.title: It is really my worst investment in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 and half years installation, the faucet become very difficult to shut off the water. We have to spend few minutes to figure out the position to shut off the water. In addition, you also require to carefully to control the position the hot water output, we were facing several time over hot water. We spend more than $200 plus installation labor charge with a very disappointment outcome.
customer_reviews.author: M. Y. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking and solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking and solid construction. Almost impossible to install by yourself though. Need another to hold the faucet in place while you tighten the bracket underneath. Also, the identical looking water lines are marked with hot and cold inserts on the ends. But, if you have to cut off the ends of the lines to shorten them, there are no other markings on the lines to tell you which is the hot and which is the cold. Mark sure you label the lines hot and cold with pieces of tape before you cut them. Delta could eliminate this potential problem by just providing other hot/cold markings along the entire length of these two lines.
customer_reviews.author: rkmuggsy

customer_reviews.title: nice looking faucet
customer_reviews.text: nice looking faucet, and works well. My only issues are; the hose attached to the spray head is nylon braded vs. metal, the handle would have to be in a very specific position to shut off the water. Also, my contractor complained about the length of it pipe that goes through the counter. my granite counter is 3cm think, which is marginally too think for the size of the pipe on the faucet. he was concerned about the stability of the faucet, given how few threats were engaged.
customer_reviews.author: Massoud Vaziri

customer_reviews.title: Like ok
customer_reviews.text: Like it but wish handle was on left. I’m always holding whatever I’m filling with right hand and have to reach across. Have to turn off just right or it drips. Like the reach and spray options and look. Niece pointed out it spins all the way around so if your sink is in an island and you have a 2 year old- well, use your imagination 🤣
customer_reviews.author: LORI

product_meta.title: Delta Faucet Leland Pull Down Kitchen Faucet with Pull Down Sprayer, Kitchen Sink Faucet, Faucets for Kitchen Sinks, Single-Handle, Magnetic Docking Spray Head, Arctic Stainless 9178-AR-DST

Kitchen sink faucets with touch-clean spray holes allow you to easily wipe away calcium and lime build-up with the touch of a finger. You can install with confidence, knowing that Delta kitchen faucets are backed by our lifetime limited warranty. Industry standard is based on ASME A112.18.1 of 500,000 cycles.

The Delta brand is focused on being more than a maker of great products: We're using water to transform the way people feel every day. We’re committed to making technology for faucets, showers, toilets and more feel like magic that makes your busy life a little easier, because we believe there’s a better way to experience water.
